title: Menopause: Busting the most common myths
description: Every woman will experience menopause, but how much do we really know about it?

title: Thunberg: I don't want to go into politics
description: The teenage activist says the world of politics is toxic and she never intended being the face of a global movement.

title: Analysis: Liz Truss asks to be given more time
description: Few Tory MPs think she should lead them into an election but they are trying to work out their next move.

title: Kevin Spacey denies sex abuse claim during testimony at his trial
description: The actor is on trial in New York over an allegation he touched a 14-year-old boy at a party in 1986.

title: Train strikes: Workers vote on further six months of walkouts
description: The RMT union is asking members if they will support further train strikes to Spring 2023.

title: Germany extends nuclear power amid energy crisis
description: Russia's disruption of energy supplies scuppers Germany's plan to exit nuclear power this year.

title: Ex-UK pilots lured to help Chinese military, MoD says
description: Up to 30 former UK military pilots are thought to have gone to train members of China's Army.

title: The Papers: 'Hunt takes charge' in 'astounding' U-turn on tax
description: The chancellor's new economic plan and the future of the PM leads most of the papers.

title: Emiliano Sala: 'A tragic plane crash; a stain on football's reputation'
description: Emiliano Sala's plane crash death shocked the football world. We've since learned the extent to which that world shaped his path.

title: Millions of people should be paying less for their broadband
description: Providers are failing to promote the cheapest tariffs available for pensioners and people on benefits.

title: Rent increases: What you can do about a rise from your landlord
description: The BBC's Lora Jones tells you four things you can do, if your landlord asks for more money.

title: How Iran state TV tries to control story of protests
description: Iran's state-run media puts forward a very different narrative of the protests from what is being shared on social media.

title: Ukraine prisoner of war: 'I ask God that he doesn't get tortured'
description: The family of Leonid Yevseyev, a Ukrainian prisoner of war, still hope for his safe return.

title: I'll lead Tories into next election, says embattled Liz Truss
description: The PM apologises for mistakes, after her chancellor tears up almost all of her tax-cutting agenda.

title: Booker Prize 2022: Sri Lankan author Shehan Karunatilaka wins with supernatural satire
description: The prestigious book prize is won by Shehan Karunatilaka, for his novel The Seven Moons of Maali.

title: Ballon d'Or: Karim Benzema wins award as best player in world football for first time
description: Real Madrid and France forward Karim Benzema wins the Ballon d'Or - awarded to the best footballer of the year - for the first time.

description: France secure a 34-12 victory as Greece make their Rugby League World Cup debut in Doncaster on Monday.

title: Ballon d'Or: Real Madrid's Karim Benzema proud of journey to winning award
description: Watch as Real Madrid's Karim Benzema wins the 2022 Ballon d'Or, becoming the first French player to win the trophy since Zinedine Zidane in 1998.

title: Glastonbury 2023: Tickets for festival rise to £340
description: Prices for the world-famous festival have risen by £70, organisers have confirmed.

title: Rugby League World Cup: Greece score first ever World Cup try
description: Watch the moment Siteni Taukamo scores Greece's first try in their first World Cup match against France at the Eco-Power Stadium, Doncaster.

title: Women's Ballon d'Or: Alexia Putellas wins award for being best female footballer in 2022
description: Barcelona captain Alexia Putellas has retained the Women's Ballon d'Or, awarded to the best best female footballer of 2022.

title: Another whirlwind day for politics... in 60 seconds
description: As more radical policy ideas were blitzed by the new chancellor, PM Liz Truss kept a low profile.

title: Warning of 'scary' spending cuts after tax U-turns
description: New chancellor Jeremy Hunt said "almost all" of the tax cuts announced by his predecessor will go.

title: BBC 100: Lenny Henry on Una Marson’s faded legacy
description: Sir Lenny Henry reflects on the extraordinary life of the writer, BBC producer and presenter Una Marson.

title: Liz Truss: How might Tory MPs get rid of the prime minister?
description: As Liz Truss's political future hangs in the balance, Tory MPs are plotting ways to oust her.

title: Plan to remove bankers' bonus cap to go ahead
description: Jeremy Hunt dismantled much of the mini-budget, but will still be scrapping the cap on bankers' bonuses.

title: Russian tower block in flames as aircraft crashes
description: A military plane went down on or near a multi-storey building in the southern town of Yeysk.

title: Kanye West agrees to buy right-wing platform Parler
description: Ye "will never have to fear being removed from social media again", Parler boss George Farmer posts.

title: Fuel protests in more than 90 countries, BBC analysis
description: People are protesting around the world against food and petrol price rises, BBC research finds.

title: Nicola Sturgeon's plan for an independent Scotland
description: Nicola Sturgeon has set out her proposals for currency, borders and debt in an independent Scotland.

title: King Charles meets refugees in Aberdeen
description: The monarch met a family from Afghanistan given a new home by a woman moved by their plight.

title: NFL: Patrick Mahomes, Josh Allen, Ja'Marr Chase make plays of the week

title: Headless body found with Bible quote and rope, jury hears
description: Mee Kuen Chong's body was also found with rope in her handbag, the trial of her alleged killer hears.

title: Lucy Letby trial: Nurse injected air into baby who died, trial told
description: A mother of twins pleaded "don't let my baby die", the jury at Lucy Letby's murder trial hears.

description: Wasps make 167 redundancies as they follow Worcester Warriors as the second Premiership club in three weeks to go into administration.

title: BBC's Dharshini David: I've never seen anything like this

title: Red Bull budget cap breach 'constitutes cheating' - McLaren boss Zak Brown

title: Uefa's organisation of Champions League final a failure, panel finds

title: Jeremy Hunt: We will reverse almost all mini-budget tax cuts

title: BTS: K-pop stars to take time out for military service

title: Mason Greenwood appears in court over attempted rape charge
description: Manchester United player Mason Greenwood is also charged with assault and controlling behaviour.

title: Jurgen Klopp red card among incidents prompting referee charity to call for inquiry into managers

title: Pressure mounts on Liz Truss ahead of Jeremy Hunt statement
description: New Chancellor Jeremy Hunt is expected to U-turn on more of the government's tax-cutting plans later.

title: Booker Prize 2022: Queen Consort to award prestigious prize

title: Chancellor Jeremy Hunt to fast-track tax and spending measures
description: The move is designed to help reassure jittery markets before they open in London this morning.

title: Met officer faced 11 misconduct allegations

title: Watch: Hong Kong protester beaten up in China consulate grounds
description: The man was pulled into the Chinese consulate grounds in Manchester and beaten up.

title: Dartford Crossing closure: Two people climb up QE2 Bridge
description: There is queuing traffic on the M25 in both directions after police closed the bridge.

title: Independence economy would 'work for everyone' - Sturgeon
description: The first minister is publishing a paper on the economic case for Scotland becoming an independent nation.

title: Hong Kong protester dragged into Manchester Chinese consulate grounds and beaten up

title: Al Jazeera staff allege harassment and bullying went unchecked
